Posts.Content: I think security should be tighter. One thing I observed in Portsmouth, Ohio was that anyone could walk in off the streets and go straight to a patient’s room. Where I get treated in Florida, there is only one way in and visitors must show ID’s and get a new one made for that day, only. All other doors remain locked and you can’t just wonder in off the street without getting stopped. Guards will stop you without a hospital ID. As a patient, I like that.
Posts.Title: How should we improve hospitals?
